intro: Tofieldia gracilis, commonly known as slender tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and marshes. Tofieldia gracilis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
